title: Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 455 of 2011)) and the Health (Delegation
heading: 3. Part I of the First Schedule (as amended by Article 2 of the Food Safety
text_raw:
3. Part I of the First Schedule (as amended by Article 2 of the Food Safety 
Authority of Ireland Act 1998 (Amendment of First and Second Schedules) 
Order 2011 (S.I. No. 724 of 2011)) to the Act is amended— 

(a) 

by deleting the following Act: 

“Animal Remedies Act, 1993 (No. 23 of 1993) (other than 
Sections 4 and 5)”, and 

(b) by inserting after “Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 

2006 (No. 8 of 2006).” the following Act: 

“Veterinary Medicinal Products, Medicated Feed and Fertilisers 
Regulation Act 2023 (No. 21 of 2023).”.

heading: 4. Part II of the First Schedule (as amended by Article 3 of the Food Safety
text_raw:
4. Part II of the First Schedule (as amended by Article 3 of the Food Safety 
Authority of Ireland Act 1998 (Amendment of First Schedule) Order 2023 (S.I. 
No. 222 of 2023)) to the Act is amended— 

(a) 

by deleting the following statutory instrument: 

“European Communities (Equine) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 357 
of 2011).”, and 

(b) by inserting the following statutory instruments: 

“European Union (Veterinary Medicinal Products and Medicated 
Feed) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 36 of 2022). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 14th June, 2024.

2023 (S.I. No. 254 of 2023).”.

title: Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 455 of 2011)) and the Health (Delegation
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order amends the First Schedule to the Food Safety Authority of Ireland 
Act 1998. 

This Order may be cited as the Food Safety Authority of Ireland Act 1998 
(Amendment of First Schedule) Order 2024. 

For ease of reference, a list of all food legislation and official agencies, as 
contained in the First and Second Schedules to the Food Safety Authority of 
Ireland Act 1998, as well as a list of Regulations made under the European 
Communities Act 1972 and deemed to be food legislation for the purposes of the 
Food Safety Authority of Ireland Act 1998, and Regulations made under the 
Health Act 1947 as amended by section 25 of the Irish Medicines Board 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2006, can be found on the website www.fsai.ie 
(https://www.fsai.ie/enforcement-and-legislation/enforcement/fsai-act-andrelated-legislation) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [284] 21 

BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 
ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR 
Le ceannach díreach ó 
FOILSEACHÁIN RIALTAIS, 
BÓTHAR BHAILE UÍ BHEOLÁIN, 
CILL MHAIGHNEANN, 
BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 8, 
D08 XAO6

r-phost: publications@opw.ie
